There appears to be significant disagreement on just what leaning this board has. Personally I've always found it right leaning, but there are more than a few out there who seem to find it overly left.
 
 So what political inclination are you?
 
 Personally I am a bit of a mix. I am generally a social conservative, and so would consider myself right wing. But I also have many left wing sympathies. I agree with the wings (from a UK point of view) broadly on:
 
 Gay marriage- left
 Gun laws- right
 Tax- left
 Healthcare- left
 Education- right
 Death penalty- right
 Iraq war- right
 Abortion- left
 Hunting- right
 Europe- left
 Monarchy- right
 (edit) Imigration- Left
 
 So a bit of a mix.

Adept

Gay marriage- For. Marriage should be a union between two people who love each other. And if then invent true AI, then I'm all for people marrying robots if they want.
 
 Gun laws- shall issue policy in all areas with regards to concealed carry permits. There is no link between firearm ownership and homicide rates. People should be allowed the tools with which to defend themselves and pusue their hobbies.
 
 Tax- Varied tax brackets with higher amounts being taken from higher earners. Extreme limitations on government expenses, such as travel bils, refitting offices for senators, business dinners, etc.
 
 Healthcare- Basic level of free healthcare. Those who wish to can pay for extra or better care.
 
 Education- Free education to high-school level.
 
 Death penalty- All for it. Make it quicker and more efficient. Utilise it for rape and pedophilia.
 
 Iraq war- I believe we should have kept our noses out of it. But now that we are there, we should take the time to do the best job we can of it.
 
 Abortion- All for it. However, if it is possible for the baby to be removed and placed in hospital care, that option should be taken before killing the baby.
 
 Hunting- License required, with license fees going to provide proper hunting grounds and game reserves. Bag limits where applicable.

fracas

Gay marriage- civil union instead
 Gun laws- ownership restriction on military weapons only
 Tax- low tax, user based, even flat
 Healthcare- consumer pays
 Education- high school for all, but needs to expand on civic responsibility education
 Death penalty- ok with it
 Iraq war- ok with it

sanguinekane

Gay marriage- I support it, though the idea of marriage between anyone, straight or gay, seems to get more ridiculous every day to me.
 Gun laws- restrictions on fully automatic weapons (but not banned), permits for ownership, and dagerous criminals banned from ownership. Guns are crucial for ensuring protection from a tryannical government, and for personal protection.
 Tax- Progressive tax, the more you make, the more you pay, with a cap somewhere around 40%.
 Healthcare- Free health care an option, with private plans for those who want them.
 Education- Free education through high school, and we definately need to put more money and focus more attention on the problem.
 Death penalty- Support it
 Iraq war- Government lied in order to embroil us in a war that will probably end up creating a revolution in this country.
 Abortion- Up through the first three months
 Hunting- Personally, I find it distasteful unless you're doing it with a spear or bow and arrow (whats fair about taking out a dear from half a mile away with a sniper rifle?), but I don't want to stop people from doing it altogether. Restrictions are needed, and outright bans (punishable with death) on hunting endangered or threatened species.
 Europe- I support the EU, but I live in the US, so take this with a grain of salt. Great institution, and i thnk the idea of a united European continenet needs to be something the member countries should devote a lot of their energy working towards.
 Monarchy- As long as it is me :) I think a democratic system is a lot better.
 Imigration- Legl immigrants areall good. Illegal ones should be treated humanely, but sent back to their home countries, but after they've been told how to immigrate legaly. 
 
 I don't know what that makes me. I like to think of myself as a progressive or liberal or whatever, so I call myself left-wing, but it is all a matter of perspective.

Phunting

To expand:
 
 Gay marriage- All for it
 
 Gun laws- For a relaxation of the laws allowing privately owned hand guns again
 
 Tax- Generally happy as it is.
 
 Healthcare- Happy with national healthcare. Though do agree that the system needs a shake up.
 
 Education- I feel Labour should stop this unrealistic drive to get every single kid to university and concentrate on vocational training where appropriate. This would allow a much fairer support system for university students too. There needs to be considerably less regulation, putting education back in teacher's, and not politician's, hands. Fully in favour of public schools (that's private schools for you Americans!).
 
 Death penalty- Fully in favour where warranted.
 
 Iraq war- It was handled badly, but I have no real problems with it.
 
 Abortion- Totally the mothers right.
 
 Hunting- Against the recent ban. I don't really like the sport itself, but am against banning something because it doesn't quite appeal personally.
 
 Europe- Am generally pro integration, although sceptically.
 
 Monarchy- A die hard monarchist. I see her as a figurehead, and wouldn't want anything more. But as a symbol of our country I'm strongly for her.
 
 Immigration- Within limits, am more than happy. I don't believe in quotas, or it the tabloid scare stories that we are overrun.

Gay marriage- Allow the same benefits, just call it something else. Better yet, remove the government benefits of marriage, and let any adult declare a union w/whoever (and however many) they wish. Marriage can remain in its religious context then.
 Gun laws- Allow guns for any lucid, law-abiding citizen. Deny it from the insane and felonious.
 Tax- Reformed to a consumption/VAT system. And only increased by 2/3 majority and Pres. sig.
 Healthcare- Those that can pay for their own, pay for their own. Limit the medical insurance prices, and allow outside (foreign) competition if the prices do not come back to a reasonable level.
 Education- Paid and controlled by the states. Reformed to match the changing job situations. And required levels of learning thru HS.
 Death penalty- Allow for the slam-dunk cases of murder. And all life-sentences MEAN life - no parol.
 Iraq war- Would not it supported given today's knowledge, but will be a good thing if handled correctly now.
 Abortion- Allow in cases of rape and maternal health threats. Disallow after 6th month. Also reform the adoption system so the involved cannot be tracked - ever. All attempts to find biological parents/kids expressly forbidden
 Hunting- Absolutely allowed when the target is not endangered. And all fees go back to the protection of said wildlife.
 Europe- Should be an open-border system of commerce and interraction. AFA the rest (same laws, etc.), undecided.
 Monarchy- Should not be in control of any part of government, and should fend for themselves. 
 Imigration- Allow when viable. Anyone illegally border-hopping banned from ever legally emigrating. emoticon_idea And perhaps tatooed as well :) 
 
 Also, change the lobbying laws so no politician can have worked for as a lobbyist then enter government for at least 5 years before. And cannot become a lobbyist for at least 10 years after leaving the political position.
 
 And add a balanced budget amendment. Even in times of war, taxes would have to be raised (by vote illuminated above). Absolutely no deficits ever again.

 I don't know where you yanks get this idea that 'if you don't like it get out'. What kind of society would that create? I don't want those who have opposing views to me to pack up and leave, political progress is only made through effective opposition, it's our safeguard from totalitarianism.

 
 I am not saying anything of the sort...........This is my country and I am here for the duration of my life.........We have had a Liberal president in Clinton for 8 years...........Although I disagreed with him on a lot of issues I did not hate him like my left wing buddies in this forum hate President Bush........
 
 You are right about the political process though and the democratic party because of their left wing liberal radical views has little or no chance to win major national elections during the rest of my lifetime..............
 
 We are a country made up of mostly moderates and conservatives....They call us the silent majority....We do our speaking at the ballot box and as you can see it is working well........
Voice Of Reason

I find it difficult to believe that anyone who spent a majority of his/her adult life in the military, unquestionably following orders 24/7/365, understands the concepts of freedom. That background would indicate a civilian comfort zone of being given orders, policy, that also use control as a behavioral factor. I've spoken to senior LE people who discuss those same qualities as being desirable in patrol officers never rising above that rank, unquestionably following authoritarian orders which provide the basis for their personal ideology.

 
 I am 67 years old and was in the military for 21 years..Hardly the majority of my adult life........
 
 It is obvious you know nothing about the U.S. military except what you liberal military haters has brainwashed you with...........
Voice Of Reason

May I just point out the exception to this point: Paul Daniels. I'm sure you, along with most of the UK population, were disapointed when he didn't stick to his word and leave the UK after Blair came to power ;)

 
 We have had many hollywood elites say that if President Bush was elected they would pack up and leave.............So far none have done so........
 
 Truth be told, they never had it so good.........
daewoo

Well I really have only one question for you after all that drivel........If President Bush is so bad and caused all those problems why did he get re elected by a margin of over 3,000,000 votes, make gains in every state he won, and picked up seats in both the HOR and the Senate?
 
 Let me try and answer it for you......Looks like your opinion is in the small minority of left wing nutsos and mine is in the mainstream of America.........

 
 Then why do latest polls show only 35% approval for his actions by the US people? Bush has some fo the lowest approval ratings we have seen in years. Even his daddy, who had some pretty **** poor approval ratings, was ahead of Baby bush. 
 
 Thanks to Bushs actions, it appears that the republicans will likely loose control of congress in 2006 (by over 6 percentage points).
 
 You seem to have bushes mental block when it comes to planning fro more than 6 months in advance. Sure, Bush won, my guy lost (but since I voted for a real conservative he had no chance anyway). The damage bush has done will virtually ensure that the republicans do not retain congress, or the white house after Bushs term is up. WAY TO GO. You XXXXXX screwed yourselves. Good job.
 
 
 BTW....I did not say that bush was the problem....I said XXXXXX like YOU are the problem.
Phunting

You are really saying when the liberals get to power, you will seriously denounce the US and move abroad?

 
 
I am not saying anything of the sort...........This is my country and I am here for the duration of my life.........We have had a Liberal president in Clinton for 8 years...........Although I disagreed with him on a lot of issues I did not hate him like my left wing buddies in this forum hate President Bush.

 
 
Well that is you.Personally myself if I did not like where I was living I would go somewhere that I liked.........Why stay here if you are so miserable and you are losing more and more with every election.
Joined up debating? Isn't that exactly what you said?
Phunting

We have had many hollywood elites say that if President Bush was elected they would pack up and leave.............So far none have done so........
Under no circumstances is Paul Daniels considered the 'elite'!
 
 
Truth be told, they never had it so good
In your (rather skewed) opinion. Actual truth be told, Bush has ruined much of the country.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Political Standing?
